p:
Data from Fig. 2b was obtained from epidemiological studies were identified through Google Scholar search utilizing keywords “Parkinson”, “genetic”, “population”, “familial”, and the relevant gene names (i.e. LRRK2, PRKN/PARK2, ATP13A2, SNCA, VPS35, PINK1, DJ-1, and DNAJC6). A total of 50 epidemiological studies
93– 129 were used for the analysis (total n = 488 patients carrying various mutations and 32,012 PD cases). The frequency of mutation (PD population with mutation/total PD population) was averaged across studies examining the same gene. Only studies containing sample sizes of >100 subjects were included in the analysis.
